articles.title: Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islet Assailed by North and South
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islet Assailed by North and South
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Korean Buddhist Federation, the south Korea-Japan Buddhist Welfare Association and the Memorial Society for the Monument to the Victory in the Battle in the Northern Area of Korea issued a joint statement on Oct. 18 to accuse Japan of its moves to grab Tok Islet. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Japanese authorities recently decided to describe Tok Islet as part of the territory of Japan in the "new teaching guidelines" for primary and middle school students and officially announced it. This is a wanton infringement upon the dignity and sovereignty of the Korean nation and an unpardonable crime.
					
					 Japan, the worst war criminal state, is seeking to fan up the territorial ambition among the young Japanese and grab a land of other country still today when more than 60 years have passed since its defeat. Through this, the Korean people clearly realize once again the inveterate criminal nature of the land of islands. 
					
					The fellow countrymen of the north and the south of Korea regard the above-said moves of Japan as a dangerous act of aggression to realize its old dream of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" and vehemently denounce them. 
					
					 Tok Islet has always remained part of the inviolable territory of the Korean nation and will stand so in the future, too. 
					
					 Japan should bear in mind that its brazen-faced claim to the land of other country will only precipitate its own destruction and had better behave itself, not forgetting the lesson drawn from its defeat in the 1940s. 
					
					 Japan should stop at once such foolish moves to seize Tok Islet and make apology and reparation for its crimes committed against the Korean nation in the past. 
					
					All Koreans in the north and the south who value the dignity of the nation and territorial integrity will in the future, too, hold Japan accountable for its past crimes to the last and go united closer and steadily conduct actions to check and frustrate the above-mentioned moves of Japan, the statement stressed.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Grave of Ri Po Ik
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Grave of Ri Po Ik
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the grave of Ri Po Ik, ardent patriot, in Mangyongdae, Saturday on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of her demise.
					 Seen standing before the grave was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, Ro Tu Chol and Kim Yong Dae and officials of party and power organs, ministries and national institutions and servicepersons of the KPA and working people in the city.
					
					 Placed there were wreaths in the name of the Central Committee of the WPK, ministries and national institutions, scientific, educational and cultural and arts institutions, revolutionary schools and party and power organs and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the noble life of Ri Po Ik who added shine to the patriotic and revolutionary tradition of the Mangyongdae family and devoted herself to the country and its people.

articles.title: Patriotic Life of Ri Po Ik
articles.content:
Patriotic Life of Ri Po Ik
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- The Korean people with deep emotion are looking back upon the brilliant life of Ri Po Ik, an ardent patriot, on the occasion of her death anniversary (October 18, 1959).
					 Her affection for the Mangyongdae revolutionary family members helped them grow up to be true revolutionaries with love for the country and the nation.
					
					 After the demise of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, she said to President Kim Il Sung: "Jungson (grandson), you will have to take over the burden your father was carrying now. You must pick up the cause where he left off and win back the country, come what may. You may have no chance to take care of me or your mother, as is your filial duty, but you must give yourself heart and soul to the cause of Korea's independence."
					
					 He was deeply impressed by her words and gained great strength therefrom.
					
					 It was her temperament and spirit not to submit to any coercion and injustice.
					
					 When the Japanese imperialists forced Koreans to change their names to Japanese ones, she did not respond to the demand but resisted stubbornly their pernicious colonial rule, thus demonstrating her ardent patriotism.
					
					 She held fast to the principles as the mother and grandmother of great revolutionaries when the Japanese imperialists made desperate efforts to attain their heinous aim while concentrating all "punitive" forces on the headquarters of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and launching "surrender campaign."
					
					 She said, "You may take me along by force, but I won't help you. Instead, I will look around Mt. Paektu and Manchuria where my grandson is fighting against you, just to see who will be the winner."
					
					Whenever the enemy poked her in the back with a rifle butt to make her call out her grandson's name, she retorted, "I don't know how to blabber wild nonsense like that. Anyway, do you think you can kill me and get off scot-free? Go ahead, kill me if you want to end up with my grandson's bullet in your skulls!"
					
					 Finally giving up on their attempts, the enemies who mobilized her to the "surrender campaign" were compelled to send her back to Mangyongdae.
					
					She was not a professional revolutionary. And she neither attended school nor received any revolutionary education in an organization. But she strongly resisted the enemies and behaved sturdily. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung writes about it in his reminiscences that the tradition of the Mangyongdae family and the revolution turned her into such a heroic woman.
					
					 Even after the liberation of the country, she led a simple and upright life till the last moments of her life though she was the grandmother of the head of state.

articles.title: Anniversary of DIU Marked in Pyongyang and Local Areas
articles.content:
Anniversary of DIU Marked in Pyongyang and Local Areas
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Art performances took place at theaters in Pyongyang and local areas on Friday on the occasion of the 82nd anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU). 
					 Artistes of national art troupes performed at theatres in Pyongyang.
					
					Artistes of the National Symphony Orchestra staged a concert at the Moranbong Theater. Its repertoire included instrumental music and vocal music including piano concerto "Song Devoted to Comrade Kim Jong Il", orchestral music "Thunder on Jong Il Peak" and "Rich Harvest Comes to the Chongsan Plain" and  string orchestra for pizzicato "This Country Is So Good".
					
					 Meanwhile, artistes of the State National Art Troupe staged a music and dance performance at the Open-air Theater of the Youth Park. Their program included female quartet "It Is October", female solo "O, Mother Party" and chorus "Let Us Continue Our Revolution under the Banner of Songun".
					
					 The art performances deeply impressed the audiences as they helped deepen the reverence for President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il who demonstrated the dignity and might of Songun Korea to the whole world by successfully applying the idea of anti-imperialism, independence and socialism advocated by the DIU to the more than 80-year-long history of the Korean revolution.
					
					 An oratorical performance was given at the State Drama Theatre, bringing joy and optimism to the citizens significantly celebrating the above-said day.
					
					Similar art performances were given at theatres in local areas including Kangwon Province, North and South Hamgyong provinces, North Hwanghae Province and North Phyongan Province.

articles.title: DPRK FM and His Party Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK FM and His Party Back Home 
 Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun and his party flew back today after visiting Russia. 
					 They were greeted at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery E.Sukhinin.
					
					Pak paid a courtesy call on Valery Yadev, deputy speaker of the State Duma, and was entertained to a reception given by Russian FM Sergei Viktorovich Lavrov during his stay in Russia.
					
					He placed a wreath at the Tomb of Unknown Soldier by the wall of the Kremlin and visited the national space flight center and others.

articles.title: South Korean Visiting Group Leaves
articles.content:
South Korean Visiting Group Leaves
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- The visiting group of the "Yun I Sang Peace Foundation" of south Korea headed by Director Sin Kye Ryun left here Saturday by air after participating in the 27th Yun I Sang Concert.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Idea of DPRK Foreign Policy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Idea of DPRK Foreign Policy
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Independence, peace and friendship are not only the fundamental idea of the DPRK foreign policy but a noble idea common to humankind as they help strengthen the international solidarity and accelerate the cause of global independence, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the basic principle governing the activities of the DPRK government to take an independent view and judgement on all matters, act according to its faith and solve all the problems in an independent manner.
					
					The DPRK will as always respect the sovereignty of other countries and resolutely foil all attempts and moves to infringe upon the sovereignty and interests of others and interfere in other's internal affairs.
					
					 The DPRK is a peace-loving state.
					
					The Korean people will always wage a dynamic struggle to foil the imperialists' moves for aggression and war and protect the peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world in unity with all the peace-loving people of the world under the uplifted banner of peace. 
					
					 It is a sure guarantee for promoting the cause of global independence to boost the friendship and solidarity among the peoples advocating independence. 
					
					 It is the consistent policy of the DPRK government to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with all the countries that respect the DPRK's sovereignty.
					
					The DPRK will make efforts to develop the international relations on the principle of independence and the international justice and improve and normalize the relations with those countries which were in the hostile relationship with the DPRK in the past if they respect its sovereignty and roll back their hostile policies towards it.
					
					 The DPRK's just foreign policy is greatly conducive to actively promoting the development of the sound international relations and making the world independent and multi-polar.
					
					 The above-said idea of the DPRK government's foreign policy is unchangeable and sure to triumph.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Spirit of Struggle Displayed in Annals of Korean Revolution
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Spirit of Struggle Displayed in Annals of Korean Revolution
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- The spirit of struggle displayed in the past annals of the Korean revolution is noble revolutionary spirit all Korean people should firmly carry on in the general offensive at present and it serves as a powerful treasured sword for creation and change that makes it possible to bring about a new revolutionary upswing in the socialist construction in the era of Songun.
					 Rodong Sinmun today observes this in signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Enshrined in the above-said spirit of struggle are all the ideological and moral traits and the fighting spirit the revolutionaries should be possessed of.
					
					First of all, the spirit of struggle serves as an important ideological and moral source which enables the DPRK to give full play to the might of single-minded unity in the general offensive at present.
					
					The spirit of struggle displayed in the past annals of our revolution is characterized by intense loyalty of upholding the party and the leader with faith and conscience and the do-or-die spirit in which the people lay down their lives without hesitation to safeguard the leader.
					
					 The spirit also serves as an ideological and moral foundation enabling our army and people to fully display the firm will and militant stamina by which they can do anything in the on-going general offensive.
					
					 Whenever there created grim situation in which the destiny of the revolution and the country and the nation was placed at risk the revolutionaries of the DPRK have successfully overcome the difficulties with indomitable faith and will and persevering spirit of offensive, thus converted adversity into favorable conditions and misfortune into blessing. 
					
					The secret of miracles in the struggle finds its manifestation in launching brave offensives going through the difficulties with conviction in victory.
					
					The said spirit also serves as a powerful engine for bringing about great advance in displaying the spirit of self-reliance in the general offensive today.
					
					The general offensive at present represents the advance in the spirit of self-reliance. This provides a sure guarantee for defending the independent dignity of the Korean people and herein lies the inexhaustible source of working signal miracles.

articles.title: Suppression of Democratic Forces by Lee Myung Bak Group under Fire
articles.content:
Suppression of Democratic Forces by Lee Myung Bak Group under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- There created in the south Korean society a terror-ridden atmosphere and politically reactionary trend in which all the people desirous of national reconciliation, unity, the alliance with the north and reunification are being suppressed as "enemy-benefiting elements", "leftist forces" and the "reds" due to the vicious fascist offensive of the Lee Myung Bak's group. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a signed commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group's reckless suppression of the pro-reunification democratic forces is a frontal challenge to the south Korean people who desire new politics and new life, and a crime against the nation and reunification aimed to prevent the trend of the June 15 era of reunification from advancing toward independent reunification, peace and prosperity and push the inter-Korean relations into catastrophe. Therefore, the crime can never be pardoned in any case. 
					
					 The traitorous group's suppression of the democratic forces standing for reunification is, in essence, a premeditated fascist act to mercilessly repress and stamp out activities of the south Korean reunification movement organizations and progressives by linking them with the north under the pretext of "wiping out pro-north leftist forces". 
					
					 The group is groundlessly terming the pro-reunification patriotic activities of the south Korean progressive organizations and figures "enemy benefiting activities" conducted at the instructions of the north. This is a far-fetched assertion which can convince no one. 
					
					 The south Korean National Intelligence Service crafted even such farce as "spy ring case" in a bid to do harm to the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration. This fact clearly shows how reckless the fascist group has become in its foolish moves to stamp out at random all the activities of the south Korean reunification movement organizations by branding them as "pro-north leftist forces" and their activities as "enemy-benefiting ones".
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that if the group is allowed to commit the crime of mercilessly suppressing the just patriotic activities for reunification of the south Korean people by linking them with the north, all the democratic forces for reunification will be destroyed and the fascist dictatorship revive in south Korea and this will further escalate the confrontation between the north and the south and hinder the implementation of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the October 4 declaration in the end, the commentary concludes.

articles.title: U.S. Moves of Threatening Peace on Korean Peninsula Flayed
articles.content:
U.S. Moves of Threatening Peace on Korean Peninsula Flayed
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration in south Korea issued a statement titled "The U.S., immediately stop the moves of threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula" on Oct. 15.
					 Referring to the fact that the U.S. nuclear aircraft carrier "George Washington" entered the Pusan Port on Oct. 6, it asserted that this shows that the U.S. is still seized with wild ambition to provoke a war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Strongly denouncing the U.S. for escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula even by bringing the nuclear carrier while talking about "dialogue", the statement urged the U.S. forces, root cause of all sorts of misfortune, to immediately quit south Korea.

articles.title: Struggle against Lee Group's Corruption and Irregularities Launched in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle against Lee Group's Corruption and Irregularities Launched in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Organizations of people of different social standings of south Korea launched the struggle to denounce the Lee Myung Bak group for committing such corruption and irregularities as taking away subsidy granted for farmers.
					 Members of the Central Association of Agricultural Managers of south Korea on October 16 ploughed rice fields in Thaean County, South Chungchong Province protesting against the 100 odd high-ranking public officials including the puppet vice-minister of Health, Welfare and Families who illegally took away the subsidy.
					
					The organization also launched information service in demand of the punishment of public officials who have been engrossed in corruption and irregularities.
					
					 The Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society called a press conference in Seoul on the same day and urged the authorities to make public the full list of public officials who illegally took away the subsidy.
					
					 The "government" should probe the truth behind the case and severely punish those criminals of corruption and irregularities, the solidarity stressed.
					
					 At the end of the press conference, the solidarity thrust an open questionnaire to "Chongwadae" in demand of disclosing the truth about the embezzlement of the subsidy by public officials at minister or vice-minister level so far kept unknown.
					
					 The Government Employees' Union of south Korea also held a press conference in front of the administration building of the "government" and accused the public officials of getting the subsidy which should have been paid to farmers, branding it as the crime of exploiting the products of labor by the strength of power.
					
					 Civic and public organizations including the Citizens' Council for Right Society simultaneously released statements in which they strongly urged the puppet vice-minister of Health, Welfare and Families to step down and called for punishing those who illegally acquired the subsidy.

articles.title: "Law on Assembly and Demonstration" in S. Korea Termed Unjust
articles.content:
"Law on Assembly and Demonstration" in S. Korea Termed Unjust
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- The Catholic Human Rights Committee of south Korea laid bare the injustice of "the law on assembly and demonstration" on Oct. 13.
					The committee held that the said law which stipulates that "any demonstration likely to pose a direct threat to social order should not be allowed" is ambiguous in the standard to judge it. 
					
					In fact, there is great possibility of rallies and demonstrations critical of the "government" policies being banned in advance by the above-said law as the right to judge the "direct threat" is in the hands of the police authorities, the committee noted, and continued:
					
					 The "law on assembly and demonstration" infringing upon the freedom of assembly is illegal.
					
					 On Oct. 9 the Seoul Central District Court filed a suit in the "Constitutional Court", recognizing the illegality of some of the provisions of the above-mentioned law.

articles.title: All People's Struggle for Frustrating Lee Regime's Suppression Called for
articles.content:
All People's Struggle for Frustrating Lee Regime's Suppression Called for
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- The emergency people's action to protect democracy and check suppression of candlelight actions was formed on Oct. 15. It groups at least 100 civic and public organizations including the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea, the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society, the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the joint conference of human rights organizations. 
					A press conference took place in Seoul on the same day in connection with the inauguration of the organization. 
					
					Speakers at the press conference accused the Lee Myung Bak group of going mad with the fascist suppression aimed at eliminating progressive forces.
					
					They called upon the people from all walks of life to firmly unite as one to frustrate the Lee "government's" suppression of people under the pretext of "security" in a bid to turn back the clock of history. 
					
					They declared they would counter the authorities' unwarranted suppression of people under the pretext of "security" in order to protect candlelight and democracy. 
					
					They stated that the organization would form "a measure committee of families of victims to the suppression of people under the pretext of security" and simultaneously launch such a dynamic struggle as staging a joint action to check the suppression of people under the pretext of "security" across south Korea. 
					
					They called upon people from all walks of life to turn out in the nation-wide struggle to frustrate the Lee regime's above-said suppression aimed at bringing back the era of dictatorship.

articles.title: Japan's Extension of Unreasonable "Sanctions" under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Extension of Unreasonable "Sanctions" under Fire
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- An emergency meeting of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) was held at the Japanese educational hall in Tokyo on October 16 to denounce the Japanese authorities for extending unwarranted "sanctions" against the DPRK.
					 Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, made a report at the meeting.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the Japanese government took the intolerable action of extending its "sanctions" against the DPRK for the fourth time on October 10, swimming against the trend of the times and history. 
					
					The Japanese authorities' "sanctions" are aimed at making the best use of the "fiction about threat from north Korea" for turning Japan into a military power and rendering it right-wing reactionary and tearing Chongryon and Koreans in Japan from the care of their homeland and making Chongryon defunct in the end, he noted. 
					
					He strongly urged the Japanese authorities to face up to the trend of the times and properly understand the unbiased public opinion inside and outside  Japan, immediately lift the "sanctions" and stop at once the politically-motivated brutal suppression of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and their rights.
					
					 Then solidarity speeches were made by Haruki Wada, secretary general of the National Association for the Promotion of Japan-DPRK Relations, Kiko Koizumi, secretary general of the Japanese Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women, and Kenjo Kogawa, a Japanese lawyer. The floor was also taken by officials of Chongryon. 
					
					 A letter of protest to the Japanese government was adopted at the meeting.
					
					The meeting also decided to form a group of protesters with Koreans from all walks of life in Japan and stage protest actions against its Cabinet office.
					
					Present at the meeting were vice-chairmen of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, the chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon, chairmen of Chongryon headquarters in Kanto region, officials of different organizations under Chongryon and other Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Peru
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Historic Lesson in Building Socialism and the General Line of Our Party" was brought out in booklet by the Grafica Aj Hermanos Publishing House of Peru on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The work, published on January 3, Juche 81 (1992), scientifically elucidates the historic lesson drawn from the collapse of socialism in various countries on the basis of the Juche idea and expounds the idea that the general line of the WPK on strengthening the people's power and powerfully pushing ahead with the three revolutions, ideological, technical and cultural, is the most just line in building socialism as it embodies the Juche idea.

articles.title: Bulletin Issued in Austria to Mark 63rd Anniversary of WPK
articles.content:
Bulletin Issued in Austria to Mark 63rd Anniversary of WPK
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria, issued a bulletin accompanied by a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung on Oct. 10 on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The bulletin in an article introduced the President who embarked on the road of revolution in his early years and devoted his all to the freedom and independence of the country.
					
					Referring to the fact that the WPK has wisely led the struggle to eliminate the shackles of feudalism and the old remnants of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and win a brilliant victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, and successfully built socialism centered on the popular masses in the DPRK, the bulletin went on:
					
					 The WPK has thoroughly embodied the Juche idea founded by the President in all fields of revolution and construction and achieved the unity and cohesion among the leader, party and popular masses.
					
					 The WPK holding General Secretary Kim Jong Il at its highest post has further developed into an invincible guiding force of the Korean people.

articles.title: Cause of Reunification of Korea Supported by Indonesian Figure
articles.content:
Cause of Reunification of Korea Supported by Indonesian Figure
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Ristiyanto, acting general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Vanguard Party of Indonesia, issued a statement on the occasions of the 28th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK) and the 1st anniversary of the publication of the historic October 4 declaration. 
					He in the statement noted that the proposal for founding the DFRK set forth by President Kim Il Sung is the most reasonable one for the reunification on the Korean Peninsula as it makes it possible to achieve it peacefully by the efforts of the Korean people free from interference of foreign forces. 
					
					 He said that the October 4 declaration is a programme for fully embodying the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, a great programme for reunification which makes it possible to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country in the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					He expressed full support and solidarity with the above-said declarations, saying that they are the only proposals for reunification suited to the specific conditions in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 He strongly demanded the south Korean authorities stop at once all the unjust actions against reunification and make a switchover to the inter-Korean reconciliation and cooperation.

articles.title: Statement Issued by Egyptian Figure
articles.content:
Statement Issued by Egyptian Figure
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Wahid Al Uksouri, chairman of the Misr Arab Socialist Party of Egypt, issued a statement on the occasion of the 63rd founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The WPK has achieved great successes in revolution and construction from the very day of its foundation standing all sorts of hardships of history, strictly guided by the Juche idea and Songun idea fathered by President Kim Il Sung who is founder of the party, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The WPK led by Kim Jong Il has demonstrated its might before the world as a guiding force of the cause of Songun revolution.
					
					 The WPK put on the extraordinary high level the political and ideological might of the country by consolidating in every way the single-minded unity of the whole society and provided a reliable military guarantee for building a great prosperous powerful nation by fully embodying the Songun politics and thus made a breakthrough toward leaping advance.
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of the WPK led by Kim Jong Il, the DPRK could have gained only victories in the rigorous struggle to defend socialism and opened up a new turning point in building a great prosperous powerful nation.
					
					The WPK will always demonstrate its might as guiding force of the cause of Songun under the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 We will positively support the just cause of the Korean people.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
Important Days of DPRK Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Film shows were held in Myanmar, Austria, Russia, Thailand and Germany and by the Asian Football Confederation between Oct. 5 and 10 on the occasions of the 63rd anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 82nd anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union.
					 The participants in the film shows watched Korean films showing undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the might of the single-minded unity of Songun Korea.
					
					 After watching the film, the mayor of Yangon City, Myanmar said that the WPK is the most powerful invincible party in the world as it is guided by the great Juche idea.
					
					 The acting chairman of the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK in his speech made at the film show praised Kim Jong Il for successfully carrying forward to completion the cause of the President.
					
					 After watching the film, the general secretary of the AFC said that the DPRK has advanced without any vacillation despite all sorts of difficulties and the moves of the imperialist allied forces to pressurize it as the WPK and the Korean People's Army have successfully carried out their roles under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the film show held in Austria.

articles.title: 63rd Birthday of WPK Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
63rd Birthday of WPK Celebrated in Different Countries
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- Public figures of different countries issued statements on Oct. 8 and 9 on the occasion of the 63rd anniversary of the foundation of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					Otete Gaston Mboyo, chairman of the National Committee of the Genuine Lumumbist Patriotic Party of Democratic Congo, said in his statement that the WPK which was founded and strengthened and developed by President Kim Il Sung is shedding its rays as the party of the President both in name and reality and envied by the world progressive parties desirous of justice and socialism thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					As Kim Jong Il is leading the WPK, holding high the banner of Songun, the banner of socialism, the Korean people will always emerge victorious in the future, too, he noted, expressing the belief that the Korean people would achieve great successes in their struggle to build a great prosperous powerful nation and achieve the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					G. Debarajan, secretary of the Central Committee of the All-India Forward Bloc, said that the WPK which was founded by the President is confidently inheriting its history and tradition and fully demonstrating its might as an organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people thanks to Kim Jong Il.
					
					Harising Khang, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), expressed his belief that the WPK enjoying full support of the Korean people under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il would achieve greater successes in the future and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country without fail in the near future.

articles.title: Celebrations Held in Mongolia
articles.content:
Celebrations Held in Mongolia
Pyongyang, October 18 (KCNA) -- A meeting and an art performance took place in Ulan Bator on Oct. 10 on the occasions of the 20th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's visit to Mongolia, the 63rd anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 60th anniversary of the opening of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Mongolia. 
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 D. Tsakhilgaan, president of the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia, and Ch. Surenjav, chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society, referred to the fact that the two countries have long-standing friendly and cooperative relations and an excellent tradition of helping and supporting each other, adding that Kim Il Sung made efforts to develop the relations between the two countries in his lifetime.
					
					The friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries are more successfully developing under the care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, they said.
					
					There are in Mongolia the Kim Il Sung Kindergarten in Ovorhangay Province, the Kim Jong Il Kindergarten in Darhan Ol Province, the Kim Jong Suk Kindergarten in Ulan Bator City and other units which go with the august names of the three generals of Mt. Paektu, a clear expression of the Mongolian people's deep reverence for the peerlessly great persons of Korea, they stressed.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 Those who gave an art performance sang Korean songs including "No Motherland without You".

articles.title: Clausurado 27o concierto en memoria de Yun I Sang
articles.content:
Clausurado 27o concierto en memoria de Yun I Sang
Pyongyang, 18 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurado el 27o concierto en memoria de Yun I Sang.
					Se ofrecio el dia 17 la funcion de clausura en la Casa de Musica Yun I Sang.
					
					La disfrutaron el viceministro de Cultura Han Chol y otros funcionarios, los creadores y artistas de sector de cultura y arte.
					
					Tambien la vieron la viuda y la hija de Yun I Sang, el grupo de visita de la "Fundacion de la Paz Yun I Sang" del Sur de Corea presidido por el director Sin Gye Ryun, compatriotas residentes en ultramar, el embajador aleman en Corea Thomas Schafer, y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica.
					
					En la funcion actuaron la Orquesta del Instituto de Musica Yun I Sang, y un violoncelista surcoreano que libra sus actividades artisticas en ultramar 
					
					 Los artistas ejecutaron con habilidad la musica orquestal "Que no se vaya la noche en Pyongyang", el segundo y tercer movimientos de la serenata Op.48 para los instrumentos de cuerda compuesta por Tchaikovski y el concierto para violonchelo (composicion de Yun).

articles.title: Inaugurada XI Competencia Deportiva del Pueblo
articles.content:
Inaugurada XI Competencia Deportiva del Pueblo
Pyongyang, 18 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo inaugurada el dia 17 en el Estadio Kim Il Sung la XI Competencia Deportiva del Pueblo en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					En el marco del presente certamen se realizan en la capital y otras localidades los juegos de mas de 30 disciplinas, entre ellas, futbol, baloncesto, voleibol, ping-pong y atletismo.
					
					La competencia se efectua dividida en los sectores de equipos deportivos y de rama general.
					
					En el acto inaugural participaron el secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Kim Jung Rin, los funcionarios de organizaciones de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, deportistas y trabajadores.
					
					El viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros Kwak Pom Gi pronuncio discurso de felicitacion y el presidente del Comite de Direccion de Deportes Pak Hak Son, discurso de apertura.
					
					Terminado el acto, tuvo lugar la competencia de futbol (M) entre el Equipo Deportivo 25 de Abril y el Equipo Deportivo Amrokgang.

articles.title: Es invariable el ideal de politica exterior de la RPDC
articles.content:
Es invariable el ideal de politica exterior de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 18 de octubre (ATCC) -- La independencia, la paz y la amistad constituyen el ideal fundamental de la politica exterior de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea para consolidar la solidaridad internacional e impulsar la causa de verificacion de la independencia en todo el mundo, siendo el noble ideario comun de la humanidad. 
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual de este sabado y prosigue: 
					
					Actuar segun su propia fe meditando y resolviendo todos los problemas de manera independiente resulta el principio fundamental en las actividades del poder de la RPDC.
					
					En lo adelante tambien la RPDC respetara la independencia de otros paises y rechazara resueltamente todos los intentos y maniobras orientados a violar la soberania y los intereses ajenos e intervenir en sus asuntos internos. 
					
					La RPDC es un Estado amante de la paz. 
					
					Unido con todos los pueblos pacifistas del mundo bajo la bandera de la paz, el pueblo coreano luchara activamente contra las maniobras de agresion y guerra de los imperialistas y por preservar la paz y la seguridad de Asia y el resto del mundo.
					
					Consolidar la amistad y la solidaridad entre los pueblos defensores de la independencia es la garantia fundamental para impulsar la causa de independencia de todo el mundo. 
					
					El poder de la RPDC mantiene invariablemente la politica de desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con todos los paises que respetan la soberania de nuestro pais. 
					
					La RPDC desarrollara las relaciones internacionales a base del principio de independencia y justicia internacional y se esforzara por mejorar y normalizar las relaciones con los paises, que la trataban con hostilidad, si ellos respetan su soberania y abandonan la politica hostil a si misma. 
					
					La justa politica exterior de la RPDC hace gran aporte al desarrollo sano de las relaciones internacionales y al impulso activo de la independencia y multipolarizacion del mundo. 
					
					Es invariable e inquebrantable el ideal de la politica exterior del poder de la RPDC.

articles.title: Entidades de Norte y Sur de Corea condenan a Japon
articles.content:
Entidades de Norte y Sur de Corea condenan a Japon
Pyongyang, 18 de octubre (ATCC) -- El CC de la Federacion de Budistas de Corea, la Asociacion Budista para el Bienestar Sur de Corea-Japon y la Sociedad Memorial con Pukgwandaechopbi (monumento a una victoria del pueblo coreano en la Guerra Patriotica Imjin) hicieron publica el dia 18 una declaracion conjunta condenando las maniobras de Japon encaminadas a usurpar la isla Tok.
					Recientemente, las autoridades japonesas confirmaron y anunciaron oficialmente su decision de anotar la isla Tok como su territorio en la "Nueva guia ensenanza" para los alumnos primarios y secundarios, comienza la declaracion y continua:
					
					Esto deviene una flagrante violacion a la dignidad y soberania de la nacion coreana e imperdonable acto criminal.
					
					Hasta la fecha, a mas de 60 anos desde su derrota en la Segunda Guerra Mundial, Japon, peor Estado criminal de guerra, maniobra para arrebatar territorios ajenos sembrando el expansionismo territorial en las nuevas generaciones.
					
					Esta conducta nos deja ver una vez mas los cronicos atributos criminales del pais isleno. 
					
					Toda la nacion coreana en el Norte y en el Sur denuncia tajantemente las maniobras de Japon encaminadas a usurpar la isla Tok calificandolas de peligroso acto de agresion para implantar la "Esfera de coprosperidad de gran Asia oriental", con lo que este pais isleno ha sonado desde hace mucho tiempo.
					
					La isla Tok fue, es y sera siempre una parte del sagrado territorio nacional de Corea. 
					
					Japon debe saber que sus atrevidas tentativas de arrebatar las tierras ajenas traeran la destruccion del propio archipielago japones y actuar con prudencia sacando las lecciones de su derrota sufrida en la decada de los 40 del siglo pasado. 
					
					En particular, tiene que parar ahora mismo sus acciones encaminadas a arrebatar la isla Tok y pedir perdon e indemnizar por su pasado lleno de crimenes cometidos contra la nacion coreana. 
					
					Todos los coreanos del Norte y el Sur, que aprecian la dignidad nacional y la integridad territorial, balancearan hasta el final esos crimenes y libraran tenazmente con sus fuerzas unidas las acciones practicas para frustrar el intento de Japon de extorsionar la isla Tok.
